alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 13 at 3:36AM PDT until June 16 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf of 3 to 6 feet expected. Minor tidal overflow around the time of high tide. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...From 9 AM PDT this morning through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Pooling of sea water is possible around high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. Enhanced beach erosion is also possible. No significant damage is expected. There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest tide of 7.2 to 7.4 feet will occur each evening from Monday through Wednesday evening between 855 pm and 1045 pm PDT.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
